content: anthro-tastic headband designed by vera sanon okay so there is a headband/ear warmer that is really cute but it retails at a price that is way out of pattern notes in the pattern directions sts from the provisional cast on and my budget at almost $100 if you are in the same the last row worked are grafted together budget category as me let s knit one instead you can find multiple tutorials on the internet alternatively you can work a regular cast on and bind off in pattern in the last row and then seam the headband together using a mattress stitch i found that using a thicker sized dpn like a size u s 9 5 5 mm worked better than using a cable needle for the cross over cable at the center of the headband you could also use a circular needle in the cable row the 2x2 rib pattern is disrupted because there will be 4 k sts in the center but in the following ws the 2x2 rib pattern will be re established this means that the first half of the row the k & p sts match up with the k & p sts from the previous row but in the second half of the row size 4 5 /11 5 cm wide and 17 19 21 /43 48 5 53 5 the sts won t match up from the previous row this is not an cm long to fit 18 20 22 /46 51 56 cm head error the changes will not be visible from the rs of the circumference fabric just work a few more row and you will see materials directions loops & thread cozy wool 50% wool/50% acrylic 90 co 16 sts using provisional cast on method yds/80m per 4 5 oz/127g skein super bulky yarn r1 rs p1 *k2 p2 * repeat to last 3 sts k3 1 skein the larges sizes uses approx 52 yds/48 m r2 ws p3 *k2 p2* repeat to last st k1 1 set of us # 13 9 mm needles spare dpn or large cable needle or spare circular needle repeat r1 & r2 until piece measures 8 9 10 /20 5 23 tapestry needle 25 5 cm ending with a ws row gauge 9 sts & 12 row= 4 inches in stockinette stitch next r rs p1 slip next 6 sts onto dpn hold in front gauge is not critically important if you work the cowl in work next 8 sts from working needle p2 k2 p2 k2 work a less bulky yarn it will not be as wide just work next 6 sts from dpn k2 p2 k2 work 1 remaining st from additional row to get the necessary length working needle k1 next r ws p3 *k2 p2* repeat to last st k1 abbreviations st/sts stitch/stitches repeat r1 & r2 until piece measures 17 19 21 /43 co cast on ws wrong side row 48 5 53 5 cm long
